children.name: piece b2
children.definition: piece sth that has been produced by an artist, musician, or writer
examples: an orchestral/ piano/ instrumental piece
piece of music/writing/sculpture etc
some unusual pieces of sculpture
the lso will perform a much-loved concert piece.
a skilful pieceofwork/research
did you read that piece (= article) in the newspaper?

children.name: treasures x
children.definition: treasures very valuable works of art, especially ones that are very old: kho tàng
examples: the exhibition shows treasures from ancient china.
the museum houses many priceless treasures.
art treasures
some of spain’s most valuable art treasures are housed in el prado.
stolen art treasures

children.name: work b2
children.definition: work sth created as a result of effort, especially a painting, book, or piece of music : tác phẩm
examples: her later works reflected her growing depression.
some of the director’s best works were created during his neo-realist period.
the poetic works of tagore
the collected works of shakespeare
work by
it is another accomplished work by the artist.
the museum has many works by picasso as well as other modern painters.
the collection contains works by kahlo and picasso.
complete works of sball the things that someone has producedtoàn bộ tác phẩm của ai
the complete works of william shakespeare

children.name: original b2
children.definition: original a work of art or a document that is not a copy, but is the one produced by the writer or artist : nguyên tác, nguyên bản, bản gốc
examples: the colours are much more striking in the original.
i’ll keep a copy of the contract, and give you the original.
if the painting is an original, it will be very valuable.

children.name: work of art x
children.definition: work of art a painting, sculpture, poem, piece of music, or other product of the creative arts, especially one that most people agree is of veryhighquality:tác phẩm nghệ thuật
examples: from a single lump of clay, torrence had produced a work of art.
the sketches were never meant to be works of art but are beautiful nonetheless.
the best works of art deal with man’s struggle with the human condition.
the thieves stole several valuable works of art.

children.name: masterpiece c2
children.definition: masterpiece/ masterwork a picture, sculpture, film etc that is ofextremelyhighquality, especially one that is believed to be the best work of a particular artist :kiệt tác
examples: adam smith’s masterpiece ‘the wealth of nations’ was written in the 18th century.
thirteen people helped michelangelo create his masterpiece on the ceiling of the sistine chapel.
the davis-evans recording of ‘porgy and bess’ has been rightly called a jazz masterpiece.
‘otello’ is verdi’s riveting masterwork.

children.name: school x
children.definition: school a group of painters, writers, poets, etc. whose work is similar, especially similar to that of a particular leader : trường phái
examples: the flemishschool
the impressionist schoolofpainting

children.name: from an a piece of art
extract b2
children.definition: extract a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc : đoạn trích
examples: extract from
i’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
they published an extract from his autobiography.

children.name: excerpt x
children.definition: excerpt a short piece taken from a book, poem, piece of music etc
examples: excerpt of/from
an excerpt of the speech appeared in the sunday paper.
an excerpt from her new thriller will appear in this weekend's magazine.
excerpt[ t ] mainly us
this passage of text has been excerpted from her latest novel.

children.name: sb who is very interested in the arts
cultured x
children.definition: cultured describes sb who has a good education and knows a lot about art, literature, music etc: văn hóa
examples: sempaio is a highly cultured lawyer with a love of classical music.
the art nouveau cafe is a popular meeting place for the city’s cultured classes.

children.name: patron of the arts x
children.definition: patron of the arts sb who supports the arts, especially with money: bảo trợ nghệ thuật
examples: a genuine culture lover, the prime minister was a patron of the arts on a grand scale.
performances are sponsored by fast food restaurants and other unlikely patrons of the arts.

children.name: culture vulture x
children.definition: culture vulture informal sb who is very interested in all the arts - use this to talk about people like this: người mê nghệ thuật
examples: while the culture vultures looked round the ruined temples, the rest of us headed straight for the beach.
he’s a bit of a culture vulture - he goes to the theatre just about every week.

children.name: arty x
children.definition: artyuk /artsyus  sb who is interested in or knows about art and culture - use this when you do not approve of people like this : ra vẻ nghệ sĩ
examples: jake’s having a party for all his arty friends.arty-farty/artsy-fartsy
he thought of the band as just an artsy-fartsy bunch of students pretending to play rock ‘n’ roll.

children.name: aesthetic x
children.definition: aesthetic/ estheticus describes an object or a work of art that shows great beauty : có tính thẩm mỹ
examples: furniture which is both aesthetic and functional

children.name: art form x
children.definition: art form a way of expressing ideas, for example in a painting, dance, piece of writing etc:hình thức nghệ thuật, loại hình nghệ thuật
examples: ballet is a 400-year-old art form, born in the courts of europe.
lehr tries to help her students understand that theater is an expressive art form.
music is quite unlike any other art form.

children.name: culture b1
children.definition: culture art, music, theatre, film, literature etc especially produced by a particular society or a particular group in society: văn hoá
examples: the italian ministry of culture
the magazine is devoted to rock music, fashion, and other aspects of youth culture.
johnson’s mother stressed intellectual and artistic achievement, while his father considered intellect and culture to be unmanly.
you won't find much culture in this sleepy little town, i'm afraid!
if it’s culture you’re looking for, the city has plenty of museums and art galleries.
popular culture(= the music, books, films etc that are liked by a lot of people) văn hóa đại chúng

children.name: the arts x
children.definition: the arts the various branches of creative activity, such as painting, music, literature, and dance, etc all considered together : nghệ thuật (nói chung)
examples: government funding for the arts has been reduced.
more government money is needed for the arts.
public interest in the arts
the visual artscreative art whose products are to be appreciated by sight, such as painting, sculpture, and film-making (as contrasted with literature and music) nghệ thuật thị giác
the approach to the visual arts has changed in the last two decades.
the decorative artsthe design and production of beautiful things for the home, such as furniture, pottery, and cloth : nghệ thuật trang tríthe exhibition will also cover the decorative arts.
the plastic artsart that involves producing objects such as sculpures or pots :the decline of the plastic arts in the fifth century
the performing artsdance, music, or drama, done to entertain people :san diego’s school for the creative and performing arts

children.name: art a2
children.definition: arta2  the making of objects, images, music, etc. that are beautiful or that express feelings: nghệ thuật
examples: the art of photography
can television and pop music really be considered art?
i enjoyed the ballet, but it wasn't really great art.
performance arta type of art that can combine acting, dance, and other actions to express an idea :it will be a mixture of live performance art, music and poetry in an informal club setting.
artb2 [c] an creative activity through which people express particular ideas: nghệ thuật
drama is an art that is traditionally performed in a theatre.
do you regard film as entertainment or as an art?
she is doing a course in the performing arts.

children.name: sb who does not like art
philistine x
children.definition: philistine disapproving sb who does not like or understand art, literature, music etc - used by people who disapprove of people who do not have this knowledge:người thiên về đời sống vật chất
examples: i wouldn’t expect a philistine like you to understand my paintings.
the american desire for material goods caused europeans to dismiss them as philistines.

children.name: cultural b1
children.definition: culturalrelating to art, literature, music etc
examples: the principal feels that cultural education is very important.
baroque music was part of a broader cultural movement that affected all the arts.
the city’s rich and variedcultural life
students need to have time for relaxation andcultural activities, as well as for academic work.
in the later middle ages, prague was an importantcultural centre(= a place, usually a big city, where a lot of artistic and musical events happen ).
a cultural desert/wasteland (= a place without museums, theatres, etc.)

children.name: artistic b2
children.definition: artistic relating to art: nghệ thuật
examples: the czech republic has a long artistic tradition.
in 1881 when the first moving pictures were shown to the public, it was hailed as an ‘artistic revolution’.
the director feared that business decisions would affect the film’s artistic quality.
the artistic director of the theatre artistic endeavours a work of artistic merit
artistic endeavours
a work of artistic merit

children.name: artistic b2
children.definition: artistic (of a person) having or revealing natural creative skill:có óc thẩm mĩ, nghệ thuật
examples: his friends are all artistic - they're painters, musicians and writers.
she described her mother as ‘very intelligent and artistic’
that’s a lovely picture - i never realized you were so artistic.
my lack of artistic ability

children.name: creative b1
children.definition: creative having a lot of imagination and able to think of new and original ideas in art, music, or literature:sáng tạo ( mang tính nghệ thuật )
examples: we encourage the children to use their creative abilities
ed, you are so creative - where did you learn to draw like that?
davis was one of the most creative jazz musicians of our time.

children.name: folk b1
children.definition: folkadjectivedân gian
examples: describes artthat expresses something about the lives and feelings of ordinarypeople in a particular group or country, especially those living in the countryside
_folk art
_folk dancing

children.name: artist x
children.definition: artist sb who creates things with great skill and imagination,especially a professional performer in music, dance, or the theatre: nghệ sĩ
examples: he described her as one of the greatest film artists of the 20th century.
the obituary described nureyev as ‘a great dancer and a true artist’.
many of the artists in the show donated their fees to charity.
a recording artist
the band are not just successful recording artists - they are constantly touring and playing live to sell-out crowds.
performance artistsbwho uses acting, dance and other actions to create art that expresses an idea :a one-man show by the french performance artist, orlan

children.name: agent x
children.definition: agent a person who represents an actor, artist or writer : trợ lý
